body.p: Sessions in Phon usually consist of a media recording (either audio or video) coupled with transcriptions of utterances from the recording and separated into records. Each record can be associated via a process called segmentation to the time in the recording during which the utterance occurred.

To facilitate the segmentation and transcription of media files, Phon has a built-in media player. This player is available in the Media Player view. To use the media player, you must first have a media file assigned to your session.
body.note: Phon current only supports 16bit PCM wav files.
If the session media file is already in wav format a second file is not required for session audio.
